intro: Chorizandra involucrata, commonly known as the Cape mountain catchfly, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its small, pink or white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has a compact, mat-like growth habit and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Chorizandra involucrata is adapted to arid conditions and is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value.
